Description: Steve: Please review each topic and add your thoughts in the Your_Comments column. Update Status if you have a decision. Claude will then respond in Claude_Comments column.
What columns does your current CSV have when working with Claude Code? Share an example or describe the structure.
Claude_Comments: I need to see your actual CSV format to match it. Are you using: Issue/Description/Status? Or something else? This determines our import parser.

Description: You said: Claude 1, User 1, Claude 2, User 2 etc. Should we: (A) Add new columns each round (Claude_1, User_1, Claude_2...) or (B) Keep 2 columns and append with timestamps?
Claude_Comments: Option A = unlimited columns, harder to display. Option B = 2 columns (Your_Comments, Claude_Comments) with dated entries like '2025-11-03: Try Postgres | 2025-11-04: Yes, good choice'. Which do you prefer? Or Option C: Separate conversation log per topic?

Description: Should app: (A) Watch file automatically and notify when CSV changes, (B) User clicks 'Check for Updates' button, (C) Both options available?
Claude_Comments: File watching = convenient but uses system resources. Manual = user controls timing. Hybrid = watch is default but can disable. What fits your workflow?

Description: If Claude messes up column order should we: (A) Auto-detect columns by name (flexible), (B) Enforce strict order and show error, (C) Auto-fix and re-export?
Claude_Comments: Recommendation: Option A (detect by name). More robust. We parse headers, don't care about order. Example: ID can be column 1 or 5, we find it by 'ID' header. Agree?

Description: Build as: (A) Electron desktop app (works offline, file system access, quick build), (B) Next.js web app (upload/download CSV, hosted), (C) VS Code extension for Claude Code?
Claude_Comments: Electron = 1-2 days, use immediately, offline. Web = 3-4 days, need hosting, upload/download. Extension = 2-3 days, integrated into Claude Code. Which fits your workflow best?

Description: Where to put AI instructions: (A) First row of CSV with [INSTRUCTIONS] marker, (B) Separate .txt file (issues_instructions.txt), (C) Built into app (user doesn't see it)?
Claude_Comments: Option A = visible to you and Claude. Option B = cleaner CSV but extra file. Option C = app generates on export, invisible. I lean toward A for transparency - you can edit instructions yourself.

Description: Timeline: (A) This week (need bare minimum), (B) Next week (can wait for polish), (C) Two weeks (want it more complete)?
Claude_Comments: Determines scope. This week = import/display/export only. Next week = add file watching. Two weeks = add chat UI. What's your urgency?

Description: Which views for MVP: (A) Just list view, (B) List + detail modal, (C) List + detail + board view, (D) All views from current mock?
Claude_Comments: Simpler = faster. List view might be enough initially. Detail modal helps for long descriptions. Board view is nice-to-have. What's minimum you need?

Description: What status values to support: (A) Open/In Progress/Resolved/Closed, (B) Open/Done, (C) Custom per project, (D) Match your current CSV?
Claude_Comments: Need to know what statuses you're already using. We'll match that. Can always add more later. What's in your CSVs now?

Description: Do you need priority field (High/Medium/Low) or is status enough for now?
Claude_Comments: Priority helps sorting but adds complexity. Your call. What matters more: speed to build or feature completeness?

Description: Do you use categories/tags in your CSVs? If yes, what categories?
Claude_Comments: Helps filtering. Example: Technical, Content, Design, Bug. Or skip for MVP? What do you need?

Description: Track dates for: (A) Created + Updated, (B) Just Updated, (C) No dates?
Claude_Comments: Helpful for seeing when topics were added/changed. Low priority but easy to add. Want it?

Description: When importing updated CSV with existing IDs: (A) Update existing topics, (B) Keep both versions, (C) Ask user what to do?
Claude_Comments: If ID=1 exists in app and you import CSV with ID=1, should we update it or create duplicate? Probably update, but confirm.

Description: When exporting CSV after you've made changes in app: (A) Overwrite original CSV, (B) Create new file (issues_v2.csv), (C) Ask user?
Claude_Comments: Don't want to lose your work. Maybe always create new file with timestamp? Or backup old file first? What feels safe?

Description: Should instructions be: (A) Fixed template in app, (B) User can edit before export, (C) Saved templates (template 1: review, template 2: implement)?
Claude_Comments: You might want different instructions for different situations. 'Review these' vs 'Implement these' vs 'Prioritize these'. Templates would help. Need it now or later?

Description: Can user edit topics in the app? (A) Yes - edit any field, (B) Yes - only comments, (C) Read-only - edit in CSV only?
Claude_Comments: If you can edit in app, need to handle sync with CSV. If read-only, simpler but less useful. What's your workflow? Edit in app or in spreadsheet?

Description: Can user add new topics in app or only import from CSV?
Claude_Comments: Adding in app = more useful but adds complexity. Import-only = simpler. Phase 1 vs Phase 2 decision?

Description: Need search or filter functionality in the list view?
Claude_Comments: Nice to have but not essential for MVP. Can defer to Phase 2? Or do you have lots of topics and need it?

Description: Work with: (A) One CSV at a time, (B) Multiple CSVs (different projects), (C) Folder of CSVs?
Claude_Comments: You mentioned multiple projects. Should app handle multiple CSV files or focus on one for now? What's your use case?

Description: Can you create an example CSV file showing your current structure so I can match it exactly?
Claude_Comments: This is critical! Please share a sample CSV (can be dummy data) so I build the parser correctly. Or describe the exact columns you use.
